instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message:
This team tells me the client that it was turned off out of nowhere.

PPBUS_G3H 13.05V

CPU voltages, PPVCCCPU_S0G is 0.95 then drops to 0.66v.

There is no startup sound.

PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK present with 2.96V

AP_RESET_L 3.0V
PLT_RST_L 3.31V

RAM voltages present.

I don't know what else to do, CPU dead?

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message:
0.66V looks like CPU boots.
Check USB activity and external video.

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message: I have usb activity but I don't have external image...

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message:
Flexgate problem???

Test external video disconnecting internal LCD.

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message: yes i did that I disconnected the flex from the LCD so that I can take an image through the USB c to HDMI adapter and nothing...

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message:
If you get USB activity, then Caps Lock light must react too.
Is that the case?

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message:
no, the keyboard light does not turn on, and the top case works because it is from a computer that is 100% operational.

There is no light on the keyboard but there is click on the trackpad it is very strange

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message:
TP click is not a life sign.
If Caps Lock doesn't react, I bet no USB activity present; be sure to check properly.
I was talking about USB activity, not USB power.
USB mouse with light on, doesn't confirm activity.

Did you try known good BIOS?

threads.title: 820-00840 no power
threads.message: I don't understand when you mean usb activity... but when I connect a usb c to normal usb the led lights up
